meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a basilica.
meanings.sent1: The basilic architecture of the church was grand and impressive.
meanings.sent2: The basilic columns in the building added a sense of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The basilic design of the new library made it look like a miniature palace.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a basilic flair, with intricate patterns reminiscent of ancient buildings.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the basilic essence of the basilica in his painting.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Roman building.
meanings.sent1: The ruins of the basilic were a reminder of the Roman civilization.
meanings.sent2: Visiting the ancient basilic was like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent3: The tour guide joked that the basilic was the Roman version of a shopping mall.
meanings.sent4: The basilic stood tall, a symbol of the architectural prowess of the Romans.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the basilic felt like exploring a piece of history frozen in time.

meanings.definition: A type of Christian church building.
meanings.sent1: The basilic was filled with worshippers attending the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful stained glass windows adorned the walls of the basilic.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the townspeople sought shelter in the basilic.
meanings.sent4: The bells of the basilic rang out, signaling the start of the evening prayers.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere in the basilic was serene and peaceful, perfect for reflection.
